node.title: National overtakes Labour in new political poll
node.description: The National Party has overtaken Labour in the latest political poll released this evening, with 39 percent support compared to Labour's 37 percent.

node.title: Marlborough council significantly raising dump prices to afford levies
node.description: Landfill prices in Marlborough are set to increase, in a bid to encourage people to send less waste to the dump.

node.title: Bryce Edwards: Labour's poll slip reflects 'crisis' positioning
node.description: Opinion - Bryce Edwards says an Autumn of discontent could be reflected in 1News' poll showing a dip in support for Labour.

node.title: Biggest annual increase in food prices in a decade
node.description: Food prices levelled out last month but still had their biggest year-on-year increase in more than a decade.

node.title: Wairarapa mayors hope three waters recommendations will be accepted
node.description: A working group, comprising of local government leaders, presented their three waters reforms recommendations to the government this week.

node.title: Rural sector calls for fuel price relief
node.description: Rural industries struggling with rising fuel costs are calling on the government to reduce fuel taxes to make it more affordable.

node.title: Investigations into Covid-19 provision 'void' for disabled and at-risk
node.description: Research into vaccine distribution shows problem gaps Audio

node.title: Digital building marketplace raises $35m, eyes Australia expansion
node.description: An online building marketplace wants to expand to Australia, after receiving backing from a big-name investor.

node.title: Reliance on domestic market continues for feijoa growers
node.description: Feijoa season has got underway and high freight costs means orchardists are focused selling their produce to the domestic market.

node.title: Farmer confidence down despite high commodity prices
node.description: Farmer confidence is the lowest it's been since 2009 a new survey has found, despite record high commodity prices.

node.title: Two new Matariki winter festivals to get funding
node.description: Two new winter festivals marking Matariki have received government backing with hopes they will become internationally significant.

node.title: Super Rugby Aupiki: A game of two halves
node.description: Opinion- Last night certainly showed that Aupiki will be useful in manufacturing pressure situations for the best players against one another, writes Jamie Wall. Video

node.title: Facebook allows posts calling for violence against "Russian invaders"
node.description: But the company says calls for violence against Russian civilians will not be allowed.

node.title: Monthly rents skyrocket amid record inflation: "It's impossible to prepare for"
node.description: Inflation is causing prices to increase across the board, especially monthly rent — which soared nearly 20% last year in the U.S.

node.title: Mental health professionals step in to help deescalate 911 calls
node.description: Some police departments are dispatching mental health professionals instead of officers to certain emergencies.

node.title: Black teen publishes book to combat a lack of representation in the Deaf community
node.description: "It makes you feel bad when you don't see yourself," Khyiana Tate said.

node.title: Covid-19: RATs could have been used sooner - associate health minister
node.description: The Associate Health Minister says Auckland should have moved to using rapid antigen tests (RATs) earlier than it did. Audio

node.title: Billionaire steel magnate heads list of Russians with NZ business interests
node.description: Public records show wealthy Russians own $60m in real estate in Aotearoa - 50 percent more than the prime minister previously said.

node.title: This week on "Sunday Morning" (March 13)
node.description: A look at the features for this week's broadcast of the #1 Sunday morning news program

node.title: Minister doubles down on revealing private information about Charlotte Bellis
node.description: Covid-19 Response Minister Chris Hipkins has refused to admit he made a mistake or apologise after releasing private information about journalist Charlotte Bellis. Video

node.title: COVID pandemic death toll may be 3 times higher than official tally, study finds
node.description: A new study of "excess deaths" estimates the pandemic's true toll has already surpassed 1 million in the U.S.

node.title: White Ferns win back-to-back at world cup
node.description: New Zealand bowlers restrict India as White Ferns win second Women's Cricket World Cup game.

node.title: Man arrested for fatal stabbings of Florida couple
node.description: The arrested individual has been identified as Jean R. Macean.

node.title: Who will be Auckland's next mayor?
node.description: Auckland will have a new mayor after the local elections this year. The Detail talks to three frontrunners for the job.

node.title: Biden faces intensifying Democratic pressure to end border expulsions
node.description: A Ukrainian mother and her children fleeing the Russian invasion were turned back at the U.S. border by officials who cited a Trump-era restriction, according to the family's lawyer.

node.title: Ohio State's Harry Miller announces medical retirement, citing mental health stuggles
node.description: "There is help, always," the former offensive lineman wrote.

node.title: Hipkins unapologetic over Charlotte Bellis disclosures
node.description: Covid-19 Response Minister Chris Hipkins is now refusing to comment on the case of Charlotte Bellis, after ignoring ministerial advice not to share details about her.

node.title: IRS announces plan to hire 5,000 workers — No experience needed
node.description: The tax agency says it wants to hire thousands of workers on the spot at hiring events on March 16, 23 and 30.

node.title: Michael Flynn takes the Fifth in meeting with January 6 committee
node.description: Former national security adviser Mike Flynn took the Fifth during his deposition before the January 6 committee.

node.title: KiwiSaver funds invested in companies linked to Putin's regime
node.description: Greenwashing remains rampant among KiwiSaver fund managers, as investors grow more conscious about where their money goes to.
